htmlQuestions.qText: The correct way to declare an element selector in a css file is using the hash character (#)
htmlQuestions.explanation: To declare an element selector, we write the name of the html tag and it will modify all of them, unless they are overridden

htmlQuestions.qText: What is the correct syntax to open a link in a new tab?
htmlQuestions.explanation: To open a link in a new tab we can use: Google

htmlQuestions.qText: What html tag can we use to create a paragraph? (No <> required. For example if the question asks which tag to use to create an ordered list, just write ol)
htmlQuestions.explanation: The p tag can be used to create a paragraph in HTML

htmlQuestions.qText: What is the correct html code to produce the following output?
htmlQuestions.explanation:
The correct answer is

Hello World!

. To create the heading we use the h2 tag and to make it bold and green we can use font-weight and color respectively

htmlQuestions.qText: What is the output of: ?
htmlQuestions.explanation: The first image is correct. Using percents, the edge radius starts at the center rather than using a circular arc so the resulting shape is more oval like

htmlQuestions.qText: The correct way to declare class selector in a css file is using the dot character (.)
htmlQuestions.explanation: To declare a class selector, we use a dot/period followed by the name of the class and it will modify all classes with that name

htmlQuestions.qText: Fill in the blank: <link rel='_____' href='project3_CSS.css'>
htmlQuestions.explanation: To connect an external CSS file in HTML, we use the stylesheet key word

htmlQuestions.qText: What html tag can we use to use JavaScript? (No <> required)
htmlQuestions.explanation: The script tag can be used to write JavaScript or connect an external JS file

htmlQuestions.qText: What is the correct html code to produce the following output?
htmlQuestions.explanation:
The correct answer is

Hello World!

. To create the paragraph we use the p tag and to make it italycized we set the font-style to italic

htmlQuestions.qText:
What is the output of:
  1. red
  2. blue
  3. green
?
htmlQuestions.explanation: The second is correct. The ol tag creates an ordered list, which numbers the list items

htmlQuestions.qText: The correct way to declare an id selector in a css file is using the hash character (#)
htmlQuestions.explanation: To declare an id selector, we use a hash (#) followed by the name of the id and it will modify the element with that id

htmlQuestions.qText: What does CSS stand for?
htmlQuestions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. Note:This can be seen in when we link a css file we use rel='stylesheet'

htmlQuestions.qText: What html tag can we use to create a clickable link? (No <> required)
htmlQuestions.explanation: The a tag can be used to create a clickable link in HTML

htmlQuestions.qText: What is the correct html code to produce the following output?
htmlQuestions.explanation:
The correct answer is

Hello World!

. We use p to create a paragraph and to make it have a line through it we have to set the text-decoration to line-through

htmlQuestions.qText: What is the output of: <button style='background-color:#009000;'>Hello World</button>? (Hint: Hex uses rgb)
htmlQuestions.explanation: The second image is correct. The first two characters represent the red value, 3 & 4 the green, and the last two blue. Characters 3&4 are 90, while the rest are 0, which means there is a high green value, so the button must be green

htmlQuestions.qText: An element in html can have multiple ids
htmlQuestions.explanation: In html, an element can only have a singular id

htmlQuestions.qText: What does HTML stand for?
htmlQuestions.explanation: HTML stands for Hypertext Markup Language

htmlQuestions.qText: What html tag can we use to insert an image? (No <> required)
htmlQuestions.explanation: The img tag can be used to insert an image in HTML

htmlQuestions.qText: What is the correct html code to produce the following output?
options: Your name:
Your name:

What is the output of:

Hello

htmlQuestions.explanation: The first is correct. We use the br tag to create a line break
